Detailed Description

Provider the System.MemoryPressure key.

The LowMemProvider implements the System.MemoryPressure context property that has three possible values: normal, high, and critical. It works by poll(2)ing the (Maemo specific) /sys/kernel/{low,high}_watermark sysfs attributes. The following table describes the correspondence between the attributes and the value of the context property:

    low_watermark | high_watermark | System.MemoryPressure
    --------------+----------------+-------------------------
          0       |       0        |       normal (0)
          1       |       0        |       high (1)
          1       |       1        |       critical (2)
          x       |       x        |       unspecified (null)

As a side note, in Maemo terms: low_watermark means `background killing' is active high_watermark is `low memory condition' (expect the oom killer soon)

Note that these are advisory, and there are cases when the OOM killer strikes without high_watermark being 1.

Member Function Documentation

void ContextD::LowMemProvider::onFirstSubscriberAppeared (  )  [private, slot]

This is called when the first subscriber for System.MemoryPressure appears.

Here we create the watchers on the pool files and start observing.

void ContextD::LowMemProvider::onLastSubscriberDisappeared (  )  [private, slot]

This is called when the last subscriber for System.MemoryPressure disappears.

We stop observing the pool files and free the resources.

void ContextD::LowMemProvider::onWatermarkStateChanged (  )  [private, slot]

Slot called by the pools when one of them changes state.

We get the current state of the pools and, based on that, we compute the current value for the property (normal, high, critical).
